Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Spital \Spit"al\, n. [Abbreviated from hospital.] [Written also {spittle}.] A hospital. [Obs.] --Shak. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44
The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Spittle \Spit"tle\, v. t. [See {Spit} to spade.] To dig or stir with a small spade. [Prov. Eng.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Spittle \Spit"tle\, n. A small sort of spade. [Prov. Eng.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Spittle \Spit"tle\, n. [From {Spit} to eject from the mouth: cf. {Spattle}, and AS. sp[=a]tl.] The thick, moist matter which is secreted by the salivary glands; saliva; spit. [1913 Webster]
{Spittle insect}. (Zo["o]l.) See {Cuckoo spit} (b), under {Cuckoo}. [1913 Webster]
spittle n : a clear liquid secreted into the mouth by the salivary glands and mucous glands of the mouth; moistens the mouth and starts the digestion of starches [syn: {saliva}, {spit}]
